meanings.sent1: The deep, unpassable river blocked our path.
meanings.sent2: The mountain range was unpassable due to heavy snowfall.
meanings.sent3: The unpassable road sign made us turn around and find another route.
meanings.sent4: Her strict rules created an unpassable barrier between us.
meanings.sent5: The thick fog made the forest seem unpassable and mysterious.

meanings.definition: Not able to be traversed or traveled through.
meanings.sent1: The dense forest was unpassable without a machete.
meanings.sent2: The swampy marshland was unpassable on foot.
meanings.sent3: The unpassable traffic jam caused us to be late for the concert.
meanings.sent4: The language barrier made communication unpassable between them.
meanings.sent5: The high walls of the castle made it unpassable for intruders.
